verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. In Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> do I take refuge <S%H2620><s%>: How say <S%H559><s%> ye to my soul <S%H5315><s%>, Flee <S%H5110><s%> as a bird <S%H6833><s%> to your mountain <S%H2022><s%>;

For <S%H7563><s%>, lo, the wicked bend <S%H1869><s%> the bow <S%H7198><s%>, They make ready <S%H3559><s%> their arrow <S%H2671><s%> upon the string <S%H3499><s%>, That they may shoot <S%H3384><s%> in darkness <S%H652><s%> at the upright <S%H3477><s%> in heart <S%H3820><s%>;
If the foundations <S%H8356><s%> be destroyed <S%H2040><s%>, What can the righteous <S%H6662><s%> do <S%H6466><s%>?

Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> is in his holy <S%H6944><s%> temple <S%H1964><s%>; Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, his throne <S%H3678><s%> is in heaven <S%H8064><s%>; His eyes <S%H5869><s%> behold <S%H2372><s%>, his eyelids <S%H6079><s%> try <S%H974><s%>, the children <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>.

Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> trieth <S%H974><s%> the righteous <S%H6662><s%>; But the wicked <S%H7563><s%> and him that loveth <S%H157><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> hateth <S%H8130><s%>.

Upon the wicked <S%H7563><s%> he will rain <S%H4305><s%> snares <S%H6341><s%>; Fire <S%H784><s%> and brimstone <S%H1614><s%> and burning <S%H2152><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> shall be the portion <S%H4521><s%> of their cup <S%H3563><s%>.
For Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> is righteous <S%H6662><s%>; He loveth <S%H157><s%> righteousness <S%H6666><s%>: The upright <S%H6662><s%> shall behold <S%H2372><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%>.
